file_content.text: The Empire is in for quite a surprise when the attack on the Fortress begins.
Your battle plans are safe and sound, and I managed to switch the listening posts.
I retrieved the plans.
Excellent--the Empire is in for a rather rude awakening. Not only will the attack on the Fortress take them utterly unawares...
...but now we have an excellent chance of intercepting their own sensitive plans. The wheel turns.
Your battle plans are safe and sound.
I retrieved the plans.
Excellent--the Empire will see just how miserable things can be once the attack on the Fortress begins.
Things worked out this time, but I doubt the Empire's going to give up on stealing Republic secrets.
They'll try again.
No doubt you're right. You can be sure we'll stay vigilant.
I'm glad you're satisfied.
The honor is mine.
You may want to speak to your handlers about better safeguards for sensitive information.
Tighten security.
Yes, you're right to say so. We cannot afford to let this happen again.
It's most urgent that you retrieve those battle plans before the Imperials decrypt them.
Master Jedi. Your timing is fortuitous.
Ah, Major.
Ah... it seems fortune has answered me.
There's an urgent situation that concerns certain Republic parties I serve--parties interested in... secrets.
One of those secrets--a rather sensitive set of Republic battle plans--was stolen and brokered to the Imperials. It's my hope you can help retrieve it.
Safeguarding the Republic's security is of utmost importance.
Of course.
Diplomacy is usually my area, but circumstances can warrant exceptions.
Of course.
Excellent.
That's my job. I take it you know who pulled off the operation.
Of course.
The thieves are being dealt with. More important right now is getting back what we lost.
Republic intel operations aren't usually my thing, but I've got some free time to make some credits.
Sure, I'm for hire.
I assure you, I'm not bargain hunting.
I can't get involved unless you tell me who you work for.
How do you know this?
Fine, I'll be blunt--I traffic in information for the SIS. But this crisis is bigger than the handlers I serve.
My agenda's already full.
You may change your mind when you realize how important this is.
The stolen plans are for the Republic's planned assault on a supply frigate called the Fortress--the backbone of Imperial operations here.
I need you to infiltrate the Empire's intelligence base at the Corellian Communications Center and retrieve the plans before they can be decrypted.
There's something you're not telling me.
What are you hiding?
Very astute. This operation gives us another unique opportunity.
Leave it to me.
Excellent. But before you make a final decision, consider this.
Don't you have intelligence operatives for this kind of work?
Not my kind of operation.
The SIS is overwhelmed. They don't have the agents to breach an Imperial Intelligence headquarters. Besides, there's something else.
The Empire is expecting an assault to retrieve the plans--they'll have elite operatives in place. Yet they'll never expect a secondary objective.
This SIS device can override the center's listening posts--relay their Imperial data directly to the Republic. Retrieving the battle plans remains the main goal, of course, but...
You will have your plans. And overriding those listening posts should prove easy.
Not a problem.
If we can solve two problems at once, so much the better.
Not a problem.
Extract the plans, and override the posts. Don't worry--Havoc Squad lives for this stuff.
Not a problem.
I'll worry about the battle plans and listening posts. You worry about my pay.
As long as there are credits.
Excellent. Here--take the override device.
I'll get you your plans, but I'm not promising anything about those listening posts.
The battle plans come first.
I understand. Just do what you can, and I assure you, my people will be more than grateful.
But prepare yourself. The Communications Center is likely defended by some of the Empire's best snipers and assassins.
I think not. [Refuse quest]
Then don't be surprised when the assault fails and many young lives are lost.
Forgive me--my duties demand my full attention.
